description.compact: Used query string.
Bind a column to a PHP variable

docblock.description: PDOStatement::bindColumn arranges to have a particular variable bound to a given column in the result-set from a query. Each call to PDOStatement::fetch or PDOStatement::fetchAll will update all the variables that are bound to columns.

description.compact: Binds a parameter to the specified variable name

docblock.description: Binds a PHP variable to a corresponding named or question mark placeholder in the SQL statement that was used to prepare the statement. Unlike PDOStatement::bindValue, the variable is bound as a reference and will only be evaluated at the time that PDOStatement::execute is called.

description.compact: Binds a value to a parameter
Closes the cursor, enabling the statement to be executed again.

docblock.description: PDOStatement::closeCursor frees up the connection to the server so that other SQL statements may be issued, but leaves the statement in a state that enables it to be executed again.

description.compact: Returns the number of columns in the result set

docblock.description: Use PDOStatement::columnCount to return the number of columns in the result set represented by the PDOStatement object.

description.compact: Dump an SQL prepared command

docblock.description: Dumps the information contained by a prepared statement directly on the output. It will provide the SQL query in use, the number of parameters used (Params), the list of parameters with their key name or position, their name, their position in the query (if this is supported by the PDO driver, otherwise, it will be -1), type (param_type) as an integer, and a boolean value is_param.

description.compact: Fetch the SQLSTATE associated with the last operation on the statement handle
Fetch extended error information associated with the last operation on the statement handle
Executes a prepared statement

docblock.description: Execute the prepared statement. If the prepared statement included parameter markers, either: PDOStatement::bindParam and/or PDOStatement::bindValue has to be called to bind either variables or values (respectively) to the parameter markers. Bound variables pass their value as input and receive the output value, if any, of their associated parameter markers or an array of input-only parameter values has to be passed

description.compact: Fetches the next row from a result set
Returns an array containing all of the result set rows
Returns a single column from the next row of a result set

docblock.description: Returns a single column from the next row of a result set or FALSE if there are no more rows.

description.compact: Fetches the next row and returns it as an object.

docblock.description: Fetches the next row and returns it as an object. This function is an alternative to PDOStatement::fetch with PDO::FETCH_CLASS or PDO::FETCH_OBJ style.

description.compact: Retrieve a statement attribute

docblock.description: Gets an attribute of the statement. Currently, no generic attributes exist but only driver specific: PDO::ATTR_CURSOR_NAME (Firebird and ODBC specific): Get the name of cursor for UPDATE ... WHERE CURRENT OF.

description.compact: Returns metadata for a column in a result set

docblock.description: Retrieves the metadata for a 0-indexed column in a result set as an associative array.

description.compact: Advances to the next rowset in a multi-rowset statement handle
Returns the number of rows affected by the last SQL statement

docblock.description: PDOStatement::rowCount returns the number of rows affected by the last DELETE, INSERT, or UPDATE statement executed by the corresponding PDOStatement object.

description.compact: Set a statement attribute

docblock.description: Sets an attribute on the statement. Currently, no generic attributes are set but only driver specific: PDO::ATTR_CURSOR_NAME (Firebird and ODBC specific): Set the name of cursor for UPDATE ... WHERE CURRENT OF.

description.compact: Set the default fetch mode for this statement
